title: Augusta County: Clinton Hatcher to Mary Anna Sibert, July 7, 1861
summary: On military subjects, Clinton Hatcher describes the hardships of camp life, his anxiousness to see battle, his contempt for southerners who join the northern army, and his opinions on military strategy. He elaborates on his views on the inconstancy of women and on his correspondent's reputation for flirtatiousness.
keywords: Camp Life, Church/Religious Activity, Military Strategy, Patriotism, Women, American Civil War
